instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message:
Liquid Damage around TB, BL, ENET, FW, and  <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. I disabled TB, repaired ENET and FW, and replaced most of BL. I'm assuming the slowness is related to <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. Also, had a slightly corroded through hole on <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC</SIGNAL> near SMC. Fluxed SMC and heated to 190 degrees for 10 seconds. I don't have a replacement for <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and would like to know if this would cause the slowness.

PPBUS at 12.53v with charger plugged in, around 11.7v currently with 70% charged batt by itself.

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message: Slowness could be something around the SMC or the SMC itself. Replace <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> just to rule that out. What voltage do you get on AVREF for the SMC?

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message:
If board starts, <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> should be good.
Board wil only start in SMC bypass mode if <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage is not good.

Try first known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message: Replaced <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> anyway for good measure, <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> reads normally at 3.29v. Also, tried another good trackpad/flex and seems maybe a little faster but still lags, using 2 good SSDs and both are slow. I did notice that an SMC Reset wont stay shut down, it automatically starts the mac again. I guess it may be the SMC or the components around it?

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message:
Try your test OSX through USB, just in case.
Also try clean ME BIOS.

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message: Thanks for the suggestions, other hdd cable and usb caddy both yield slow results. I'll try flashing a clean me bios one I figure out how to properly use by bios flasher.

threads.title: Slow 3115, passes ASD
threads.message:
Make first backup of your chip.
Then search the forum, some clean file should be available.
